page.title: 16CARNIVAL
page.content: The present{Carnival}in Sherston started in 1973 as an intended 'one off' fund raising effort for the benefit of the building used as the {village hall}.This building was a replacement for the{medieval}tythe barn which was demolished in 1844 to provide a site for the 'National' {school}, the Methodists having founded their 'British' school a year earlier. When no longer needed for the tythes it became the drill hall for the local militia and is still known to many older villagers as the 'Rifle Range'. Now the hall is used by many of the village organisations but its upkeep and extension have to be in part covered by what has now become an annual event, inculding street market Carnival parade a multitude of outdoor {entertainments}and often a dance or a 'family' evening.
